trans-unit.source: Cryptography
trans-unit.target: Cryptography

trans-unit.source: The article provides an overview of the cryptography features available to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: The article provides an overview of the cryptography features available to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information on particular tasks, see the table at the end of this article.
trans-unit.target: For detailed information on particular tasks, see the table at the end of this article.

trans-unit.source: Cryptography
trans-unit.target: Cryptography

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: The article provides an overview of the cryptography features available to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: The article provides an overview of the cryptography features available to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information on particular tasks, see the table at the end of this article.
trans-unit.target: For detailed information on particular tasks, see the table at the end of this article.

trans-unit.source: Terminology
trans-unit.target: Terminology

trans-unit.source: The following terminology is commonly used in cryptography and public key infrastructure (PKI).
trans-unit.target: The following terminology is commonly used in cryptography and public key infrastructure (PKI).

trans-unit.source: Term
trans-unit.target: Term

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Encryption
trans-unit.target: Encryption

trans-unit.source: The process of transforming data by using a cryptographic algorithm and key.
trans-unit.target: The process of transforming data by using a cryptographic algorithm and key.

trans-unit.source: The transformed data can be recovered only by using the same algorithm and the same (symmetric) or related (public) key.
trans-unit.target: The transformed data can be recovered only by using the same algorithm and the same (symmetric) or related (public) key.

trans-unit.source: Decryption
trans-unit.target: Decryption

trans-unit.source: The process of returning encrypted data to its original form.
trans-unit.target: The process of returning encrypted data to its original form.

trans-unit.source: Plaintext
trans-unit.target: Plaintext

trans-unit.source: Originally referred to an unencrypted text message.
trans-unit.target: Originally referred to an unencrypted text message.

trans-unit.source: Currently refers to any unencrypted data.
trans-unit.target: Currently refers to any unencrypted data.

trans-unit.source: Ciphertext
trans-unit.target: Ciphertext

trans-unit.source: Originally referred to an encrypted, and therefore unreadable, text message.
trans-unit.target: Originally referred to an encrypted, and therefore unreadable, text message.

trans-unit.source: Currently refers to any encrypted data.
trans-unit.target: Currently refers to any encrypted data.

trans-unit.source: Hashing
trans-unit.target: Hashing

trans-unit.source: The process of converting variable length data into a fixed length, typically smaller, value.
trans-unit.target: The process of converting variable length data into a fixed length, typically smaller, value.

trans-unit.source: By comparing hashes, you can obtain reasonable assurance that two or more data are the same.
trans-unit.target: By comparing hashes, you can obtain reasonable assurance that two or more data are the same.

trans-unit.source: Signature
trans-unit.target: Signature

trans-unit.source: Encrypted hash of digital data typically used to authenticate the sender of the data or verify that the data was not tampered with during transmission.
trans-unit.target: Encrypted hash of digital data typically used to authenticate the sender of the data or verify that the data was not tampered with during transmission.

trans-unit.source: Algorithm
trans-unit.target: Algorithm

trans-unit.source: A step-by-step procedure for encrypting data.
trans-unit.target: A step-by-step procedure for encrypting data.

trans-unit.source: Key
trans-unit.target: Key

trans-unit.source: A random or pseudorandom number used as input to a cryptographic algorithm to encrypt and decrypt data.
trans-unit.target: A random or pseudorandom number used as input to a cryptographic algorithm to encrypt and decrypt data.

trans-unit.source: Symmetric Key Cryptography
trans-unit.target: Symmetric Key Cryptography

trans-unit.source: Cryptography in which encryption and decryption use the same key.
trans-unit.target: Cryptography in which encryption and decryption use the same key.

trans-unit.source: This is also known as secret key cryptography.
trans-unit.target: This is also known as secret key cryptography.

trans-unit.source: Asymmetric Key Cryptography
trans-unit.target: Asymmetric Key Cryptography

trans-unit.source: Cryptography in which encryption and decryption use a different but mathematically related key.
trans-unit.target: Cryptography in which encryption and decryption use a different but mathematically related key.

trans-unit.source: This is also called public key cryptography.
trans-unit.target: This is also called public key cryptography.

trans-unit.source: Encoding
trans-unit.target: Encoding

trans-unit.source: The process of encoding digital messages, including certificates, for transport across a network.
trans-unit.target: The process of encoding digital messages, including certificates, for transport across a network.

trans-unit.source: Algorithm Provider
trans-unit.target: Algorithm Provider

trans-unit.source: A DLL that implements a cryptographic algorithm.
trans-unit.target: A DLL that implements a cryptographic algorithm.

trans-unit.source: Key Storage Provider
trans-unit.target: Key Storage Provider

trans-unit.source: A container for storing key material.
trans-unit.target: A container for storing key material.

trans-unit.source: Currently, keys can be stored in software, smart cards, or the trusted platform module (TPM).
trans-unit.target: Currently, keys can be stored in software, smart cards, or the trusted platform module (TPM).

trans-unit.source: X.509 Certificate
trans-unit.target: X.509 Certificate

trans-unit.source: A digital document, typically issued by a certification authority, to verify the identity of an individual, system, or entity to other interested parties.
trans-unit.target: A digital document, typically issued by a certification authority, to verify the identity of an individual, system, or entity to other interested parties.

trans-unit.source: Namespaces
trans-unit.target: Namespaces

trans-unit.source: The following namespaces are available for use in apps.
trans-unit.target: The following namespaces are available for use in apps.

trans-unit.source: Windows.Security.Cryptography
trans-unit.target: Windows.Security.Cryptography

trans-unit.source: Contains the CryptographicBuffer class and static methods that enable you to:
trans-unit.target: Contains the CryptographicBuffer class and static methods that enable you to:

trans-unit.source: Convert data to and from strings
trans-unit.target: Convert data to and from strings

trans-unit.source: Convert data to and from byte arrays
trans-unit.target: Convert data to and from byte arrays

trans-unit.source: Encode messages for network transport
trans-unit.target: Encode messages for network transport

trans-unit.source: Decode messages after transport
trans-unit.target: Decode messages after transport

trans-unit.source: Windows.Security.Cryptography.Certificates
trans-unit.target: Windows.Security.Cryptography.Certificates

trans-unit.source: Contains classes, interfaces, and enumeration types that enable you to:
trans-unit.target: Contains classes, interfaces, and enumeration types that enable you to:

trans-unit.source: Create a certificate request
trans-unit.target: Create a certificate request

trans-unit.source: Install a certificate response
trans-unit.target: Install a certificate response

trans-unit.source: Import a certificate in a PFX file
trans-unit.target: Import a certificate in a PFX file

trans-unit.source: Specify and retrieve certificate request properties
trans-unit.target: Specify and retrieve certificate request properties

trans-unit.source: Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core
trans-unit.target: Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core

trans-unit.source: Contains classes and enumeration types that enable you to:
trans-unit.target: Contains classes and enumeration types that enable you to:

trans-unit.source: Encrypt and decrypt data
trans-unit.target: Encrypt and decrypt data

trans-unit.source: Hash data
trans-unit.target: Hash data

trans-unit.source: Sign data and verify signatures
trans-unit.target: Sign data and verify signatures

trans-unit.source: Create, import, and export keys
trans-unit.target: Create, import, and export keys

trans-unit.source: Work with asymmetric key algorithm providers
trans-unit.target: Work with asymmetric key algorithm providers

trans-unit.source: Work with symmetric key algorithm providers
trans-unit.target: Work with symmetric key algorithm providers

trans-unit.source: Work with hash algorithm providers
trans-unit.target: Work with hash algorithm providers

trans-unit.source: Work with machine authentication code (MAC) algorithm providers
trans-unit.target: Work with machine authentication code (MAC) algorithm providers

trans-unit.source: Work with key derivation algorithm providers
trans-unit.target: Work with key derivation algorithm providers

trans-unit.source: Windows.Security.Cryptography.DataProtection
trans-unit.target: Windows.Security.Cryptography.DataProtection

trans-unit.source: Contains classes that enable you to:
trans-unit.target: Contains classes that enable you to:

trans-unit.source: Asynchronously encrypt and decrypt static data
trans-unit.target: Asynchronously encrypt and decrypt static data

trans-unit.source: Asynchronously encrypt and decrypt data streams
trans-unit.target: Asynchronously encrypt and decrypt data streams

trans-unit.source: Crypto and PKI application capabilities
trans-unit.target: Crypto and PKI application capabilities

trans-unit.source: The simplified application programming interface available for apps enables the following cryptographic and public key infrastructure (PKI) capabilities.
trans-unit.target: The simplified application programming interface available for apps enables the following cryptographic and public key infrastructure (PKI) capabilities.

trans-unit.source: Cryptography support
trans-unit.target: Cryptography support

trans-unit.source: You can perform the following cryptographic tasks.
trans-unit.target: You can perform the following cryptographic tasks.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [**Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241547) namespace.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [**Windows.Security.Cryptography.Core**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241547) namespace.

trans-unit.source: Create symmetric keys
trans-unit.target: Create symmetric keys

trans-unit.source: Perform symmetric encryption
trans-unit.target: Perform symmetric encryption

trans-unit.source: Create asymmetric keys
trans-unit.target: Create asymmetric keys

trans-unit.source: Perform asymmetric encryption
trans-unit.target: Perform asymmetric encryption

trans-unit.source: Derive password based keys
trans-unit.target: Derive password based keys

trans-unit.source: Create message authentication codes (MACs)
trans-unit.target: Create message authentication codes (MACs)

trans-unit.source: Hash content
trans-unit.target: Hash content

trans-unit.source: Digitally sign content
trans-unit.target: Digitally sign content

trans-unit.source: The SDK also provides a simplified interface for password-based data protection.
trans-unit.target: The SDK also provides a simplified interface for password-based data protection.

trans-unit.source: You can use this to perform the following tasks.
trans-unit.target: You can use this to perform the following tasks.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [**Windows.Security.Cryptography.DataProtection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241585) namespace.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [**Windows.Security.Cryptography.DataProtection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241585) namespace.

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous protection of static data
trans-unit.target: Asynchronous protection of static data

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous protection of a data stream
trans-unit.target: Asynchronous protection of a data stream

trans-unit.source: Encoding support
trans-unit.target: Encoding support

trans-unit.source: An app can encode cryptographic data for transmission across a network and decode data received from a network source.
trans-unit.target: An app can encode cryptographic data for transmission across a network and decode data received from a network source.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the static methods available in the [**Windows.Security.Cryptography**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241404) namespace.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the static methods available in the [**Windows.Security.Cryptography**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241404) namespace.

trans-unit.source: PKI support
trans-unit.target: PKI support

trans-unit.source: Apps can perform the following PKI tasks.
trans-unit.target: Apps can perform the following PKI tasks.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [**Windows.Security.Cryptography.Certificates**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241476) namespace.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [**Windows.Security.Cryptography.Certificates**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241476) namespace.

trans-unit.target: Create a self-signed certificate

trans-unit.target: Import a certificate in PFX format

trans-unit.target: Use smart card certificates and keys (sharedUserCertificates capabilities set)

trans-unit.target: Use certificates from the user MY store (sharedUserCertificates capabilities set)

trans-unit.target: Specify per application trusted root certificates

trans-unit.target: Specify per application peer trusted certificates

trans-unit.target: Explicitly disable inheritance from system trust

trans-unit.target: Specify the certificate selection criteria

trans-unit.target: Hardware certificates only

trans-unit.target: Certificates that chain through a specified set of issuers

trans-unit.source: Detailed articles
trans-unit.target: Detailed articles

trans-unit.source: The following articles provide more detail on security scenarios:
trans-unit.target: The following articles provide more detail on security scenarios:

trans-unit.source: Topic
trans-unit.target: Topic

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Certificates
trans-unit.target: Certificates

trans-unit.source: This article discusses the use of certificates in UWP apps.
trans-unit.target: This article discusses the use of certificates in UWP apps.

trans-unit.source: Digital certificates are used in public key cryptography to bind a public key to a person, computer, or organization.
trans-unit.target: Digital certificates are used in public key cryptography to bind a public key to a person, computer, or organization.

trans-unit.source: The bound identities are most often used to authenticate one entity to another.
trans-unit.target: The bound identities are most often used to authenticate one entity to another.

trans-unit.source: For example, certificates are often used to authenticate a web server to a user and a user to a web server.
trans-unit.target: For example, certificates are often used to authenticate a web server to a user and a user to a web server.

trans-unit.source: You can create certificate requests and install or import issued certificates.
trans-unit.target: You can create certificate requests and install or import issued certificates.

trans-unit.source: You can also enroll a certificate in a certificate hierarchy.
trans-unit.target: You can also enroll a certificate in a certificate hierarchy.

trans-unit.source: Cryptographic keys
trans-unit.target: Cryptographic keys

trans-unit.source: This article shows how to use standard key derivation functions to derive keys and how to encrypt content using symmetric and asymmetric keys.
trans-unit.target: This article shows how to use standard key derivation functions to derive keys and how to encrypt content using symmetric and asymmetric keys.

trans-unit.source: Data protection
trans-unit.target: Data protection

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to use the [DataProtectionProvider](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241559) class in the [Windows.Security.Cryptography.DataProtection](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241585) namespace to encrypt and decrypt digital data in a UWP app.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to use the [DataProtectionProvider](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241559) class in the [Windows.Security.Cryptography.DataProtection](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241585) namespace to encrypt and decrypt digital data in a UWP app.

trans-unit.source: MACs, hashes, and signatures
trans-unit.target: MACs, hashes, and signatures

trans-unit.source: This article discusses how message authentication codes (MACs), hashes, and signatures can be used in UWP apps to detect message tampering.
trans-unit.target: This article discusses how message authentication codes (MACs), hashes, and signatures can be used in UWP apps to detect message tampering.

trans-unit.source: Export restrictions on cryptography
trans-unit.target: Export restrictions on cryptography

trans-unit.source: Use this info to determine if your app uses cryptography in a way that might prevent it from being listed in the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: Use this info to determine if your app uses cryptography in a way that might prevent it from being listed in the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: Common cryptography tasks
trans-unit.target: Common cryptography tasks

trans-unit.source: These articles provide example code for common UWP cryptography tasks, such as creating random numbers, comparing buffers, converting between strings and binary data, copying to and from byte arrays, and encoding and decoding data.
trans-unit.target: These articles provide example code for common UWP cryptography tasks, such as creating random numbers, comparing buffers, converting between strings and binary data, copying to and from byte arrays, and encoding and decoding data.
